item.title: Report E-2024120399
item.description:
Report E-2024120399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN3093 Manganese Nitrate Solution - 50% release from a 237-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 1’ area of the wood trailer floor. The tote appeared to be crushed and cracked as a result. The material was transferred from the damaged tote to a new one for shipment on. The damaged empty tote and impacted absorbents used to clean the spill were containerized into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums and submerged in water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024121064
item.description:
Report X-2024121064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SIX-SIDED CHECK ONE AIR PACKAGE WITH UN SPECIFICATION MARKINGS WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOOD INDICATORS WAS GIVEN TO A RESPONDER FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO X 8 OZ CANS OF LOCTITE EA 9395 QT AERO PART B AND TWO X 1 QUART CANS OF LOCTITE EA 9395 QT AERO PART A. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS HAVE BEEN APPLIED TO THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024120359
item.description:
Report E-2024120359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1250 ET, XPO-USB notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Spies hecker permasolid 2.1 surfacer released from a metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The 1-gallon metal drum was overpacked into a 5-gallon metal drum along with cardboard and oil dri.

item.title: Report X-2024121125
item.description:
Report X-2024121125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Javier Velasquez, a City Driver, called and stated that he had two pallets (one bag on each pallet) of UN1477, NITRATES INORGANIC, N.O.S., 5.1, PG II, that were leaking onto the trailer floor. Javier mentioned that the spill from both bags appeared to be about 8 ounces of a white rock powder on the trailer floor. He discovered the spill while in the parking lot of the customer he had just delivered to. Javier was unsure if other freight or a forklift caused the damage to the bags, resulting in the spill. He also did not know if the bags were damaged before leaving the Service Center, as there was other freight in front of the two pallets, making it difficult to see. Javier noticed the spill after unloading freight at the customer's location. Per CURA the damage was caused by a load shift.
